Note:
----------------   CREW RETRIEVER   --------------
PASTE the text created by the crew app on the WHITE CARD "description" 
conextMenu - > click last text box option
CTRL+A -> CTRL+V  -> close
CLICK the button.

------------------  CONDITIONS   -----------------
CLICK AROUND the health bar
 (mostly invisible when off) 
CLICK and RIGHT CLICK to change Value
HEALTH / AURA  behave the same

----------------   MOVE MODEL   -----------------
HOVER model and use 1-9 to start a 1-9¨ Move  use '0' for a Limitless Move
CLICK to set waypoints
DOUBLE CLICK to confirm
RIGHT CLICK to remove waypoint or abort

----------------   EXTRA MODELS   ---------------
If you need some extra reference card get it from the side boxes grouped by faction
heavy image download expected

-- Bundled by luabundle {"rootModuleName":"BaseToken.b2a137.lua","version":"1.6.0"}
local __bundle_require, __bundle_loaded, __bundle_register, __bundle_modules = (function(superRequire)
	local loadingPlaceholder = {[{}] = true}

	local register
	local modules = {}

	local require
	local loaded = {}

	register = function(name, body)
		if not modules[name] then
			modules[name] = body
		end
	end

	require = function(name)
		local loadedModule = loaded[name]

		if loadedModule then
			if loadedModule == loadingPlaceholder then
				return nil
			end
		else
			if not modules[name] then
				if not superRequire then
					local identifier = type(name) == 'string' and '\"' .. name .. '\"' or tostring(name)
					error('Tried to require ' .. identifier .. ', but no such module has been registered')
				else
					return superRequire(name)
				end
			end

			loaded[name] = loadingPlaceholder
			loadedModule = modules[name](require, loaded, register, modules)
			loaded[name] = loadedModule
		end

		return loadedModule
	end

	return require, loaded, register, modules
end)(nil)
__bundle_register("BaseToken.b2a137.lua", function(require, _LOADED, __bundle_register, __bundle_modules)
require("components/BaseToken")
end)
__bundle_register("components/BaseToken", function(require, _LOADED, __bundle_register, __bundle_modules)
TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)
end


function onLoad(save)
    --self.script_state=onSave()
    local data = JSON.decode(save)
    if data ~=nil then
        config=data["config"]
    end
end
end)
return __bundle_require("BaseToken.b2a137.lua")

Custom_Token
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
f_color = {0,0,0,95}
local firstTokenPosition={ x=-17.905245,y= 1.01,z=-7.013737}
local firstBagPosition= { x=4.954772, y=1.01, z=-16.97987 }
local objectLib={
    libeary="ab02d2";
    baseToken="b2a137";
    baseBag="d84712";
    specialTokenBag="3ea749";
}
local tokenLib={}
local bagLib={}
local waitBase=1
function onLoad(save_state)
    self.createButton({
        label="",
        click_function="genTokens",
        tooltip="Gen Tokens",
        function_owner=self,
        position={0,0.11,0},
        height=600,
        width=1000,
        alignment = 3,
        scale={x=1.5, y=1.5, z=1.5},
        font_size=300,
        font_color=f_color,
        color={0,0,0,0}
        })
end

function genTokens(_obj, _color, alt_click)
    --print(getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.baseToken).getPosition())
    --return true
    
    local libeary=getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.libeary)
    local generalTokens=libeary.call("getGenearyLibeary")
    local wait=waitBase
    local slot=1
    for key,token in pairs(generalTokens) do


        Wait.frames(function() createToken(token,slot) end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        Wait.frames(function() createBag(token,slot) slot=slot+1 end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        Wait.frames(function() joinBag(token) end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        --return false
    end
    Wait.frames(function() slot=slot+7 end,wait)
    --waitBase=600
    wait=wait+waitBase
    local specialTokesn=libeary.call("getSpecialLibeary")
    for key,token in pairs(specialTokesn) do


        Wait.frames(function() createToken(token,slot) end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        Wait.frames(function() createBag(token,slot) slot=slot+1 end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        Wait.frames(function() joinBag(token) end,wait)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        Wait.frames(function() moveSpecialTokensToBag(token) end,wait+180)
        wait=wait+waitBase
        --return false

    end
end

function createToken(token,slot)
    local pos=getTokenSlotPosition(slot)
    local newToken=getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.baseToken).clone({position=pos})
    Wait.frames(function() newToken.call("setConfig",token) end,1)
    tokenLib[token.name]=newToken.getGUID()
end

function createBag(token,slot)
    local pos=getTokenSlotPosition(slot)
    local newBag=getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.baseBag).clone({position=pos})
    newBag.setName(token.name)
    --Wait.frames(function() newBag.call("setConfig",token) end,1)
    bagLib[token.name]=newBag.getGUID()
end

function getTokenSlotPosition(slot)
    local row = 0
    local targetPos = slot
    while targetPos >= 7.5 do
        row = row + 1
        targetPos = targetPos - 7
    end
    
    return Vector( firstTokenPosition.x+ row * 2,firstTokenPosition.y  ,firstTokenPosition.z - ((targetPos) * ( 1.5)))
end


function getBagSlotPosition(slot)
    local row = 0
    local targetPos = slot
    while targetPos >= 7.5 do
        row = row + 1
        targetPos = targetPos - 7
    end
    
    return Vector( firstBagPosition.x+ row * 2,firstBagPosition.y  ,firstBagPosition.z - ((targetPos) * ( 2)))
end

function moveTokenToBag(token,bag)
    token.setPosition(bag.getPosition())
end

function joinBag(token)
    local bag=getObjectFromGUID(bagLib[token.name])
    local newToken=getObjectFromGUID(tokenLib[token.name])
    bag.setPosition(newToken.getPosition())
    bag.destroyAttachments()
    bag.addAttachment(newToken)
    newToken.clone({position=bag.getPosition()})
    --bag.setPosition(getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.specialTokenBag).getPosition():add(Vector(0,10,0)))
end

function moveSpecialTokensToBag(token)
    local bag=getObjectFromGUID(bagLib[token.name])
    getObjectFromGUID(objectLib.specialTokenBag).putObject(bag)
end

ContainedObjects.Name: Custom_Token
ContainedObjects.LuaScript:
--[[
    Created by Red Mushroom
    http://steamcommunity.com/id/Red_Mush/
    Version 1.0
    MIT License
]]

local model = 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0By25Oeqlx8F5Uk9xZEhvb3BDMGc'
local textures = {
    Gold = 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0By25Oeqlx8F5X2VjMDBWYk1uTGs',
    Silver = 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0By25Oeqlx8F5VDI3dE1KQzY0SU0',
    Bronze = 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0By25Oeqlx8F5czhHYnZhenpCT2M'
}

local function getCurrentType(tbl)
    for k,v in pairs(textures) do
        if tbl.diffuse == v then
            return k
        end
    end
    return nil
end

local function getNextType(tbl)
    local t = getCurrentType(tbl)
    if t == 'Gold' then return 'Silver' end
    if t == 'Silver' then return 'Bronze' end
    if t == 'Bronze' then return 'Gold' end
    return 'Gold'
end

function onObjectSpawn(obj)
    local guid = obj.getDescription()
    local parent = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
    if parent then
        obj.setDescription('')
        parent.putObject(obj)
    end
end

function onObjectLeaveContainer(container, obj)
    if container.getGUID() == self.getGUID() then
        obj.setScale({x=1, y=1, z=1})

        local customObj = obj.getCustomObject()
        local nextType = getNextType(customObj)

        -- spawn the next type
        local child = spawnObject({
            type = 'Custom_Model',
            position = {x=0, y=-500, z=0},
            rotation = {x=0, y=0, z=0},
            scale = {x=0, y=0, z=0},
            sound = false,
        })
        obj.setLuaScript(self.getLuaScript())
        child.setLuaScript(self.getLuaScript())
        child.setName(nextType .. ' Chest')
        child.setDescription(obj.getGUID())

        -- give it the next model
        customObj.diffuse = textures[nextType]
        child.setCustomObject(customObj)

    end
end

    Bronze = 'https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0By25Oeqlx8F5czhHYnZhenpCT2M'
}

local function getCurrentType(tbl)
    for k,v in pairs(textures) do
        if tbl.diffuse == v then
            return k
        end
    end
    return nil
end

local function getNextType(tbl)
    local t = getCurrentType(tbl)
    if t == 'Gold' then return 'Silver' end
    if t == 'Silver' then return 'Bronze' end
    if t == 'Bronze' then return 'Gold' end
    return 'Gold'
end

function onObjectSpawn(obj)
    local guid = obj.getDescription()
    local parent = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
    if parent then
        obj.setDescription('')
        parent.putObject(obj)
    end
end

function onObjectLeaveContainer(container, obj)
    if container.getGUID() == self.getGUID() then
        obj.setScale({x=1, y=1, z=1})

        local customObj = obj.getCustomObject()
        local nextType = getNextType(customObj)

        -- spawn the next type
        local child = spawnObject({
            type = 'Custom_Model',
            position = {x=0, y=-500, z=0},
            rotation = {x=0, y=0, z=0},
            scale = {x=0, y=0, z=0},
            sound = false,
        })
        obj.setLuaScript(self.getLuaScript())
        child.setLuaScript(self.getLuaScript())
        child.setName(nextType .. ' Chest')
        child.setDescription(obj.getGUID())

        -- give it the next model
        customObj.diffuse = textures[nextType]
        child.setCustomObject(customObj)

    end
end

TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    name="Adversary", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end

TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)

TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)
end


function onLoad(save)
    --self.script_state=onSave()
    local data = JSON.decode(save)
    if data ~=nil then
        config=data["config"]
    end
end
end)
return __bundle_require("BaseToken.b2a137.lua")

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)
end


function onLoad(save)
    --self.script_state=onSave()
    local data = JSON.decode(save)
    if data ~=nil then
        config=data["config"]
    end
end
end)
return __bundle_require("BaseToken.b2a137.lua")

    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.

function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end

    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end

    --self.script_state=onSave()

TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)
end


function onLoad(save)
    --self.script_state=onSave()
    local data = JSON.decode(save)
    if data ~=nil then
        config=data["config"]
    end
end
end)
return __bundle_require("BaseToken.b2a137.lua")

TRH_Class = "token"

local config = {
    --name: must be unique to your mod.
    --url: url of the asset used on the marker. Consider the design of the image and use this one as an example (white with a black outline seems to work best for contrast's sake)
    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false
}
--used to determin if the token already collided with a mini.  If the token is traveling fast enought it can colide multiple times before the self.destruct call is called
local colided=false

--I kinda hate how this is set up right now.  I should make it that each token calls a globle script so when i make changes it updates each token automaticall
--THis is probably what should happen on all generated assets with scripts.
--i wonder if lua has a extends functionallity.   Could create a sript that has this kind of function that every token inhearets.  I'll look into that later
function onCollisionEnter(col)
    if colided then
        return 0
    end
    config.count = math.max(1, self.getQuantity())
    if ((col.collision_object.getVar("TRH_Class") or "") == "mini") then
        colided=true
        if (col.collision_object.call("addMarker", config)) then self.destruct() end
    end
end
function setConfig(newConfig)
    config=newConfig
    self.setCustomObject({
        image = newConfig.image
    });
    self.setName(newConfig.name)
    --Converst bbcode to tts frendly floats
    local r=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,2,3),16)/255
    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255
    self.setDescription(newConfig.rules)
    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})
    self.script_state=onSave()
    self.reload()
end

function onSave()
    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then
        miniguid = mini.getGUID()
    end
    local save = {
        config=config
    }
    return JSON.encode(save)
end


function onLoad(save)
    --self.script_state=onSave()
    local data = JSON.decode(save)
    if data ~=nil then
        config=data["config"]
    end
end
end)
return __bundle_require("BaseToken.b2a137.lua")

    --color: valid hex color of the marker
    --stacks: true or false - can the mini receive this marker more than once.
    --name="Base", url="https://steamusercontent-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1019447087554346517/81BCB3804E00F22B1E40D6A84C85C26F04F3C5CC/", color="#DF2020", stacks=false

    local g=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,4,5),16)/255
    local b=tonumber(string.sub(newConfig.color,6,7),16)/255

    self.setColorTint({r,g,b})

    self.reload()
end

    miniguid = ''
    if mini ~= nil then

        config=config

end

    --self.script_state=onSave()

        config=data["config"]
